title: Community Forest Management
description: A quick win: understand Community Forest Management.

buildup.text: Local communities set harvesting rules, patrol boundaries, and share benefits equally.

discovery.text: Deforestation rates in community forests are lower than in government-managed ones.

twist.text: People protect what feeds them. Ownership turns locals from threats into guardians.

climax.text: Over 70 countries now have some form of community forestry in their laws.

punchline.text: The best way to save a forest is to give it back to the people.

quiz.question: Why do community-managed forests often have lower deforestation?
options: Local ownership creates strong incentive to protect
